title: The Hola Gwapa Podcast
description: Hola Gwapas! And welcome The Hola Gwapa Podcast! I'm your host and fellow Creative, Nisha Btesh. Each week I’ll be interviewing a brand new Artist from the Hola Gwapa community and we’ll be having REAL up close & personal conversations about the ups and downs of their unique journeys - highlighting all the different ways creatives at the top of their game are using to turn their passions into a paycheck! We’ll touch on topics like how to develop a solid morning routine, how to talk confidently about pricing your work, monetizing your talent & maintaining control of your finances as well as what it truly takes to build and grow a community in this digital age. Plus you know I’ll be asking for all their juicy tips, tricks and secret sauces to success! SO I hope this podcast provides you with tangible takeaways and introduces you to a wide variety of fabulous female creatives each with a different story, medium and message - but most of all I hope you walk away feeling a little less alone and more inspired than ever to keep your Artistic and Entrepreneurial hustle strong knowing that The Hola Gwapa community truly is your safe space to share, connect with and celebrate the creative in you.

title: Nieuwe Vide Radio
description:
Nieuwe Vide is een kunstpodium en broedplaats, en is ontstaan uit de kraakbeweging. Vandaag de dag bouwen we voort op de activistische idealen en DIY-mentaliteit die aan de basis lagen van onze instelling. Vanuit deze wortels zoeken we constant naar manieren om kunst en maatschappij met elkaar te verbinden, met als kloppend hart onze community in de broedplaats. We zijn verbonden met elkaar door kunst, maar ook door eten en gezelligheid.

We verbinden op een laagdrempelige manier de onderwerpen en theorieën die ons inspireren met het alledaagse en herkenbare. We werken vanuit de overtuiging dat kunst ons kan helpen om na te denken over nieuwe manieren om de wereld te bekijken en in te richten. Graag gaan we zelfs nog een stap verder dan hierover nadenken, en proberen we de ideeën die we bespreken ook dagelijks in de praktijk te brengen. We verzetten ons tegen de patriarchale norm die in onze maatschappij nog steeds leidend is, en stellen in plaats daarvan collectiviteit, waardering, zorg, overleg en emotie centraal. Daarbij haken we aan op actuele onderwerpen, zoals kapitalisme, feminisme en digitale cultuur, en zijn we niet bang om mee te veranderen met de tijd.

title: Museum Het Valkhof - De Podcast
description: Museum Het Valkhof draagt met een indrukwekkende collectie het verhaal van 5.000 jaar geschiedenis uit. Zowel in deze podcast als in het museum willen we laten zien hoe kunst en geschiedenis ons wereldbeeld kleuren. Met de tentoonstelling De Pest (2021) werden de eerste podcasts gemaakt. In dit eerste seizoen nemen diverse experts je mee door de geschiedenis van deze bijzondere infectieziekte. Hoe heeft de pest zijn sporen nagelaten in kunst en cultuur? En wat zijn de paralellen met de coronacrisis? Een jaar later was het tijd voor een nieuwe, relevante, tentoonstelling: Moving Stories: de Rijkdom van de Limes. Met deze tentoonstelling worden de migratieverhalen van  2000 jaar geleden gekoppeld met migratieverhalen van nu. Als voorbereiding op de tentoonstelling spraken de curatoren van de expositie, Marie Stel en Marenne Zandstra met een groep mensen die in de regio woont en een migratieachtergrond heeft: het public-in-residence. Ook sprak het public-in-residence, de mensen met een migratieachtergrond dus, met hedendaagse kunstenaars, die naar aanleiding van die gesprekken nieuw werk maakten voor de tentoonstelling. Een gedeelte van die gesprekken kan je horen in het tweede seizoen van de podcast.

title: The Careful Photograph
description:
“The Careful Photograph” features the voices of photographers of color who are challenging, subverting, and highlighting some of the problems and paradoxes of the photographic medium in our current moment. In each episode we focus our conversation on a single photograph by the artist. From there, I try to let the artist shape the conversation, and what has emerged are nine episodes (so far) that can be used as a teaching tool, or a course in itself about how to look at photographs and look “with care.” Each episode ends with a praxis assignment, visual exercise, or creative prompt for students or listeners. I am looking forward to sharing them with you.

“The Careful Photograph” is made possible by the MCSI at Pitzer College. As Director of the Monroe Center for Social inquiry this public podcast will serve as a companion to my MCSI course offering, “Photography and the Racialized Body,” a course which stems from my own long engagement with questions of identity, the body, and the history of photography and race in America.

title: Kunstvolle Berufsberichte: Ein Podcast des FV des Kunsthistorischen Instituts der UZH
description:

Wir haben uns daher das Ziel gesetzt den Studierenden die diversen Berufsfelder näher zu bringen, die das Studium eröffnet. Dazu führen wir mit verschiedenen Persönlichkeiten mit kunsthistorischem Hintergrund Gespräche, die wir in Form einer Podcast-Reihe vorstellen. Wir hoffen, damit zu inspirieren und neue Perspektiven nach dem Studium der Kunstgeschichte aufzuzeigen.

description:

To find out when new podcast episodes will happen, follow Miko on Instagram @MimiHanaThreads. You can also hear the interviews live as they happen on Clubhouse at the "Stitch and Bitch" club. All members who join the live interview give permission to be recorded and shared on this podcast channel, and are notified beforehand that they will be recorded before joining.

title: iDoD (iDream of Dance) DanceTalk Podcast
description:

From a 3x Guinness World Record Holder to the first woman to earn a computer science PhD from NCATU, we've lined up some super inspirational guests! Tune in to hear about their journeys, gain valuable advice, and get inspired.

DanceTalk is a podcast under the nonprofit organization iDream of Dance, whose mission is to empower youth through dance and leadership. iDream is committed to countering the growing opportunity gap and providing creative outlets for youth who wouldn’t normally occupy them due to financial need. iDoD DanceTalk focuses on the history of dance, culture, important topics in dance, and also iDream happenings. This podcast also complements the impact that dance has on peoples lives through interviews.

title: Legacy &... An Art360 Podcast
description: Legacy & brings the conversations we're having behind the scenes with artists, archivists and those caring for archives out into the world. Our discussions are reflective of the ways we work with artists to empower them to shape their archives, and are joined by the thread of Legacy. What comes after the &… can’t be prescribed and each episode is framed by speakers through their choice of title. Through informal dialogue we hope to create space for key voices in the archive to rise to the surface, and to provide a platform for artists to define themselves without a pre-determined agenda. Our conversations touch on the experience of building an archive from a practical and psychological perspective and explore parts of artists’ lives and work that may not have been shared publicly in the past. Our Podcast is co-produced and edited by Ellie Porter from Art360 Foundation and George Genn, with post-production and original score by George Genn.

title: To See or Not to See
description: We got somethin' to say.

title: COURTESY OF
description: The official Te Pātaka Toi Adam Art Gallery podcast! Te Pātaka Toi Adam Art Gallery is the purpose-built gallery of Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. It initiates, produces and presents a highly-regarded programme of exhibitions, events and publications; manages and develops Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Art Collection, and provides a vital platform for critical thinking across media, disciplines, cultures and contexts.
author_name: Adam Art Gallery Te Pataka Toi

title: Joost mag het weten
description:
Welkom bij de podcast 'Joost mag het weten'.  

De podcast waar je als luisteraar geen complete weergave krijgt, maar mag dwalen, om hier en daar een luikje open te maken; waarachter een versnipperd beeld wordt geschetst van het huidige afstudeer jaar te Sint Joost Breda, ART&RESEARCH 4 (2021). Het is juist die versnippering, die fragmentatie, die deze lichting typeert. 

Deze podcast legt de nadruk op de vertakkingen van het makerschap, haakt in elkaar waar nodig en deint mee op de golven van zij die al dobberend zoeken naar uitwisseling.

De structuur van de podcast is, net als de makers, aan verandering onderhevig. Er wordt gebruik gemaakt van bekende elementen maar is verder vrij in beweging, zo zijn er verschillende rubrieken, waarvan sommige terugkerend en andere eenmalig aanwezig.
author_name: Noëmi Francoise Hofstede; Anika Hochstenbach; Femke van Heijningen; Esther van Zoelen; Doris Kolpa; Hanne van Beek; Isa Janssen

title: Twi As We Light

Join us for biweekly book clubs, and the occasional movie review as we dive into the critically acclaimed Stephenie Meyer novel: Twilight

description:

Deeze can be found on Twitter: @DeezeFi and @DeezeSpaces



Archived Episodes can be found at www.soundcloud.com/deezefi

title: Spoken Art Journaling and Well Being
description:
This podcast will take listeners through her book, Spoken Art Journaling Vol. 1. and challenge you to look in, look up and look out to see what you might have to bring about. When you sync up the mind, heart, and spirit, it unlocks a whole new world. Welcome to the adventure of YOUR lifetime.  It's time to listen... doodle... and shine!
 
Spoken Art Journaling is designed to be both meditative and mind blowing. Three years ago, Molly caught her husband staring out into space and thought for sure he must be thinking of something earth shattering. Nope! When asked what he was thinking about, he responded with, “Nothing.” Astonished at how a person could do such a thing, his comment put her on a journey of quiet time and self-discovery. What she discovered is that thinking about nothing was not her jam. She realized that allowing her mind to express itself through color and the impressions all around her (inside & out), tapped into her heart and spirit too. She coined the technique Spoken Art Journaling and 8 journals later, she’s a happier & healthier person because of it. 

Molly Nece is CEO of GOLDEN Age Leadership (.com) and dabbles in the spirituality side of life at MollySHINES.com. She believes every person drives results and deserves to shine. Reach out to Molly for help mining your gold--it doesn't always mean dollars and it doesn't always make sense.

description:

In different episodes, we explore topics such as: What is 'broken' in the way we speak and for whom is 'broken', second language, native languages, "pollution" of English as an act of protest, class-related aspects of language, purity in language, writing, proofreading, and to what extent we should correct ourselves. We allow ourselves to go in different directions, such as humor, work, immigration, displacement or deal with topics from different regions of the world. 
And last but not least: we do not apologize for our broken English.

title: Confessions of a Rock'n'Roll Cameraman
description:
New episodes every Thursday! 

cornrc.com

In the 1980s, Culture was being shaped by immerging digital video technology.  Tony Wannamaker was one of the founders of Much Music “The Nation's Music Station”. The  messages playing out in music videos. Being a blue-collar cameraman gave Tony the ability to access and document this cultural revolution through the camera lens while adding to the cultural shift itself through his visual reporting.  
As Pat Canavan interviews Tony about his 40-year career, the podcast delves into the Canadian identity in pop culture outside of the US narrative. We get an inside look at Tony's adventures around the world, including encounters with celebrities like Sidney Poitier, musicians David Bowie, The Rolling Stones, Madonna, Lenny Kravitz and more. Then we will dive deep with sharks of unknown names or celebrity status, travel to Africa to shoot the BIG 5 and meet the Masai Prince and even explore a near-death experience.

title: Arcvantgarde
description:
“Am I stupid if I don't get it?”
 
In countless instances, many individuals find it difficult to appreciate art. Our lack of interest in art may be due to the perception that it is difficult to access. We are terrified of not understanding because we are afraid of being foolish, yet truly accessing art doesn't require a strong academic grasp of the subject matter. Art that works and reaches us does not necessitate that we be aware of the artist or source of the work. Each person is able to communicate freely with the work of the artist. And each person experiences each piece of work in a unique way. In this podcast, we enjoy, discuss and talk about art books and photo books. Let’s be foolish together!

title: Design Is Not Neutral
description: Design is Not Neutral is a podcast built from a thesis project. As a present design master's student at the University of Notre Dame, I began a broader inquiry into the way design as a field was built and the way we now teach design. After doing more research, it became clear - that design in the United States has a diversity problem. The roots of our diversity issue are squarely in how we define and teach Graphic Design. Graphic Design was made for white, cis-gendered, able-bodied men in consumer-driven societies. With this foundation, how we determine what is ‘good design’ has become extremely exclusionary. Yet, despite increased conversation around equity, design education has yet to dramatically change. The designers and design educators interviewed on Design is Not Neutral have all deeply researched the field of design education in order to improve our field. This podcast will not only provide listeners with resources on how to challenge their own perceptions of what design has been defined by, it will also provide concrete examples of how this work is being done in classrooms. I hope you enjoy each conversation as much as I did and if you liked Design is Not Neutral please check us out on Instagram.

title: Where Art and Grief Meet
description:
Where Art & Grief Meet is an exploration of the space where the creative spirit mingles with grief, loss and adversity.

Sophia, a compulsive artist who has experienced her own fair share of adversity and grief, talks with a range of notable and passionate creatives (visual, writers, musicians, entrepreneurs) to reflect and share observations and responses to the question of how their art practice is impacted by the slings and arrows of a life, acknowledging of course that grief comes in an infinite number of shapes and forms: personal and global and everything in between. 

There is no hierarchy of grief here. Loss, in this context, is viewed as an inevitable part of life and a prism through which we explore artistic practice and expression. 
 
Sophia is interested in building a space where creatives can openly discuss their observations, their stories and the resulting strategies in order to alleviate isolation, make broader connections and create a supportive community.

title: Mixed Media - A Podcast by Kavi Gupta
description:
Mixed Media is a window opened unexpectedly onto a landscape of ideas, featuring a rotating cast of artists, curators, writers, art collectors, and members of the Kavi Gupta staff, casually discussing the sweetness and mystery and chaos of great art in front of a microphone.

Kavi Gupta amplifies voices of diverse and underrepresented artists to expand the canon of art history. Through innovative and ambitious exhibitions, multimedia programming, and rigorous publications, we foster an evolving conversation among international communities about art and ideas. In addition to hosting more than a dozen major exhibitions each year, and participating in vital international art fairs, we host artist talks, facilitate special programming in support of philanthropic causes, and foster intellectual discourse by regularly bringing artists, curators, and collectors together with academics and experts in the contemporary art field.

Websters says: a note of reference, explanation, or comment usually placed below the text on a printed page. 
Footnotes enhance a reader's understanding of the text by giving references and commentary from the creator. There is value as an artist, in understanding your process. So, come sit with us and chat about how these cool people make their dream art visions come to life.

title: The Movie Rubric
description:
Many critics assign numbered scores to movies, but very few use a universal system across the board that the audience themselves can use. Here on The Movie Rubric, we narrowed down the 5 most important categories to a films success, and made a grading rubric that we will use to score each movie, much like a teacher would grade a paper, to make sure we give each movie a fair shake, and the same criteria. 

Join us as we do our best to sound smart, and try even harder to not sound stupid, and review some of the best and worst movies coming out today!

description:

The purpose of the podcast is to enable people to discover and/or learn more about web 3 artists, their journey, art, process and inspiration. In doing so, artists may expand their audiences and listeners may feel inspired to start creating and minting art of their own. Every episode is recorded via a live Twitter Space where attendees have an opportunity to ask the guest artist questions. This is a very inclusive space welcoming artists of all nationalities, backgrounds and artistic styles. Whether they have a huge following or are just starting their career, all are welcome. The show celebrates how art and creativity can bring us all together.

title: The Rising Arts Agency Podcast
description:
Hello and welcome to The Rising Arts Agency Podcast, exploring how we use our radical imaginations to create meaningful social change in the arts and cultural sector. 

YOUNG PEOPLE ARE LEADERS NOW (not in the future).

We are Rising Arts Agency, a genuinely youth-led social enterprise based in Bristol. We support the city’s underrepresented young people (18-30) to fulfil their creative ambitions and mobilise to affect radical social change through the arts. We are anti-establishment, fiercely independent and co-created with and for young people. 

Things need to change. The cultural and creative sectors are not fit-for-purpose. As our unique ways of working, thinking and facilitating become more recognised, we work both locally and nationally advocating for radical sector and cultural change through activist campaigns, research, consultation, care and our creative agency services. This podcast is our gift to you. 

We hope you find a home here. Connect with us: 

hello@rising.org.uk > join our mailing list
@RisingArtsAgency (instagram) 
@RisingArtAgency (twitter)

title: Paréntesis de Olvido
description:
El Paréntesis de olvido es un término mágico, que consiste en establecer una distancia temporal (y a veces espacial) entre el momento de la trampa y el de la revelación del efecto. Y de eso va esto, de olvidar los problemas del día a día para pasar un rato divertido. Como dijo aquella canción, “mientras la gente cuerda ríe y llora, a los locos nos verán bailando”, y eso somos, dos locos con ganas de disfrutar contando nuestras mas extrañas historias.

Bienvenidos a Paréntesis de olvido, un podcast creado por Patricia Ferrero y Jaime Copoví, donde nada es lo que parece y todo es falso, hasta que se demuestre lo contrario.

title: M(other) Artist Podcast
description:
The M(other) Artist Podcast is a collaboration between Megan Hosmer, Claire Drummond and Rena Thomas. The term "m(others)" encompasses both "mothers" and "others," including gender non-conforming and queer folks, who see themselves engaged in nurturing and sustaining life. In this podcast, we interview Kjipuktuk Halifax-based visual artists who are also primary caregivers about their experiences navigating parenting and the art world. We discuss the ways in which their art practices have been impacted by parenthood, navigating how care work can be both an exceedingly disruptive force as well as a profound emotional experience that can expand our conceptions of art-making, interdependency and existence.

Cover art by David Drummond

description:

We’ll talk about influences and inspirations, periods in life and experiences. Some emotions just can’t be harnessed, so to help manifest them into something healthy was to put them down on canvas (or other media). Tune in each week to hear stories regarding the artistic process and full details from the artist himself.

title: FORMAE MENTIS - un'esposizione di arte inclusiva

LENSart

Ascolta le podguides dell'esposizione!

FORMAE MENTIS

Uno stimolo per osservare l’arte, e il mondo in generale, con formae mentis, per l’appunto, diverse e per alcuni aspetti atipiche.

In entrambe le città l’esposizione è ospitata in due luoghi particolarmente simbolici per la crescita collettiva della comunità:

– il Salone del Palazzo dei Trecento di Treviso, edificio storico del XII secolo dove tutt’oggi si riunisce il Consiglio Comunale;

– la Biblioteca Civica di Verona, sede custode della cultura per antonomasia, due luoghi, di sapere, di incontro, di confronto e di crescita della vita cittadina.

Entrambe le esposizioni vogliono essere un punto di riferimento per una rivendicazione di diritti fondamentali della persona, perché non vengano giudicate ed etichettate in base al genere alla conformità verso dei paradigmi sociali.

title: Did you enjoy your visit?

title: That's A Them Problem
description:
Description : That’s a Them Problem — story of my life! Not really ,lol. A space where we -yes we, we are a community now- dive into the turbulent anxiety ridden often times beautiful misadventures of life and the big weird and wonderful feelings that go along with that. Yes, it will be a little queer. Yes it will be a little serious and dark BUT I promise I’ll make you laugh somehow - I mean I think I’m hilarious. Anyways - it’s always a them problem so how do we solve it - let’s talk about it? Or let’s listen to be spiral about it and you let me know after yeah? Okay luv ya :p :)<3 ew

Objective/Mission : create space to have artsy and intellectual conversations about art, life, navigating and celebrating queer stories and issues as well as tackling topics of 20 year old's existentialism and the pathways to success through the lens of a queer femme person of colour on the African continent. Build vocabulary for specific queer and youth issues that pertain to the perspective of many young queer kids but does not speak for all if them.

Show break Down:

-Produced Intro (20 secs)

  • Main Topic discussed [new topic each week] (30-45 mins)
  • videos as accompaniment to the podcast in new venues that relate to topic
  • outro produced(00:05)
  • That's A Them Problem Imaging on Socials also produced.

title: ATMO Interview With David Luong (Senior VFX Environment Artist/Matte Painter)
description:
Join ATMO as we hang out with David Luong, a veteran senior environment artist and matte painter. We'll learn about how he got started in the industry and take a look at some of his incredible work from his time at Blizzard, which you can find on our website (www.atmovfx.com). David will share some of the challenges he's faced throughout his career, as well as his strategies for success. David served as a cinematic artist at Blizzard Entertainment for 15 years working on titles such as World of Warcraft, Overwatch, Diablo, StarCraft 2, Hearthstone and Heroes of the Storm. He brings over 17 years of film & games industry experience with deep knowledge in lighting, compositing and digital matte painting. David is also known as “Eleven” at Imagendary Studios and is currently the Lead Digimatte artist for the studio. He is an enthusiastic mentor and educator in digital matte painting through the online community and co-authored the book d’Artiste: Matte Painting Vol. 3 Signup on our site and share your work! If you're a senior, we'd love to interview you! So upload your work so we can find you. :)

Website: www.atmovfx.com

title: Highbrow Honey
description:
Welcome to your biweekly bite of art history! Together we will make our way through today's ever-expanding visual culture by focusing in key moments in the subject: the weird, the infamous, the hilarious, and even the seemingly pointless. Breaking down the visual past to understand its connections to the present, host Celia Bugno brings you all the fancy "highbrow" knowledge she can get her hands on in short, sweet episodes designed to keep you hooked and just maybe teach you a little something. This is Highbrow Honey!

Celia Bugno holds a Master's in Art History, specialized in Contemporary arts, from Arizona State University (2023), and a B.A. Art History from Miami University (2016). Her primary goal in podcasting is to inspire the same love of learning in her listeners that her professors and mentors have inspired in her. Check the weekly show notes for complete source lists per episode.

title: Crafting Joy
description: Crafting Joy provides a writer's voice to crafter's hands. Join host Joy Giovanini as she carves out a space for makers to feel connection and renewal through a shared yarn.

title: How to start creating art ?!
description: In this episode we're going to talk about, how you can start creating art from nothing. Even If you don't have any experience. Stick around and let's learn and growth as artists !

title: ALFILMBET
description: In each episode of ALFILMBET, hosts Alec and Sam explore a different film, sharing their individual opinions and analyses to uncover hidden meanings and offer valuable insight. The alphabetical structure (one letter per episode, with both the filmmaker's name and the film title beginning with the same letter) allows us to discuss everything from beloved classics to little-known gems. Join us for a fun, alphabetical journey through film!

title: #ARTSTAYSHERE's Culture Crisis Conversations
description:
Culture Crisis Conversations is the new podcast series from the #ARTSTAYSHERE Coalition. We talk with those who are impacted most by arts/music/cultural displacement, including artists, musicians, advocates, operators, developers, government, policy-makers, planners, funders & more--and discuss the causes & potential solutions.

#ARTSTAYSHERE is a volunteer-run, non-profit advocacy effort to prevent arts/music/cultural displacement across Greater Boston. Sign our online petition, sign up for email updates, and learn more at www.artstayshere.org.

In partnership with New Alliance East, New Alliance Audio & The Record Co.

title: Talking Pasta
description: Impastaqqq and Calem from Rabid Mushrooms Studios interview random artists from tik tok or youtube. We help to get a better insight at the lives of small creators online.
